column4: if you want FEisty, better do a clean install, it's less likely to create problems than an upgrade
installing the drivers with nvidia installer is very easy...
stefg  is saying the opposite?
no, the drivers for Feisty are compiled for the Feisty kernel
so I dowload the installer from nvidia.com and do it manual
not that hard to reinstall after kernel update is it..
be sure you remove the ubuntu ones :    sudo apt-get remove linux-restricted-modules* nvidia-glx*
so I should remove all old beforehand?
ok thanks
what are these restricted modules? are they included in the nvidia installer then?
yep, and all the other stuff I told you before
em nothing more to uninstall ey? or did I miss something
to uninstall, no. To install, yes :p
what? I can only see the nvidia package...
oh
omg this sound complicated now... what is that then? In what order should I do this?
OK thanks, what does this last stuff include?
ok, I dont have that already then?
maybe, they won't be installed again if you already have them
ok thank you
r u there?
